meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the ancient Scandinavian poets known as skalds.
meanings.sent1: The scaldic tales were filled with brave warriors and epic battles.
meanings.sent2: Her writing style had a scaldic quality, reminiscent of the ancient poets.
meanings.sent3: The scaldic theme of the story made the children giggle with excitement.
meanings.sent4: His scaldic imagination soared like a dragon in flight.
meanings.sent5: The scaldic imagery painted a vivid picture of the frozen north.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the poetry of the skalds.
meanings.sent1: The scaldic verses were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: She studied the scaldic traditions to understand their poetic techniques.
meanings.sent3: The scaldic rhymes danced playfully in her mind.
meanings.sent4: His scaldic words were like music to her ears.
meanings.sent5: The scaldic language flowed smoothly like a gentle stream.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed an ancient scaldic for visitors to admire.
meanings.sent2: She recited a beautiful scaldic at the poetry reading.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed acting out the scaldic in their school play.
meanings.sent4: His favorite possession was a rare scaldic he inherited from his grandfather.
meanings.sent5: The scaldic captured the essence of the Viking age in its lines.
